sentences.en: A Wall Street Journal editorial encapsulated the views of many conservatives.
sentences.cn: 《华尔街日报》的一篇社论概述了很多保守派人士的观点。

sentences.en: Did you notice the appearance of a new journal in our college today?
sentences.cn: 你看到我们学院今天新出版的学报 吗 ?

sentences.en: He decided to keep a journal.
He got a job as editor of a trade journal.
sentences.cn: 他找到了一份当商业杂志编辑的工作.

sentences.en: He just published a paper in the journal Nature analyzing the fires.
sentences.cn: 他刚刚在《自然》杂志上发表了一篇分析火灾的论文。

sentences.en: He may have had some suspicions of Michael Foster, the editor of the journal.
sentences.cn: 他可能对杂志主编迈克尔·福斯特有些怀疑。

sentences.en: I have managed to tune my style to the style of the journal I am now writing for.
sentences.cn: 我努力使我的文体适合我所撰稿的杂志的要求.

sentences.en: I put my journal away and prepared for bed.
sentences.cn: 我把杂志收好，准备睡觉。

sentences.en: In the post-war years her writing regularly appeared in The New Journal.
sentences.cn: 她的文章在战后那几年经常出现在《新日报》上。

sentences.en: The " Journal of Lexicographers " is a bimonthly.
sentences.cn: 《辞书研究 》 每两月出版一期.

sentences.en: The journal rubs against the bearing surface.
The journal she had begun lay neglected on her bedside table.
sentences.cn: 她很早以前就开始看的那本杂志搁在床头柜上，好久没翻了。

sentences.en: The newly discover-ed notes are nothing more than Lang's personal journal.
sentences.cn: 新发现的笔记只不过是朗的个人日志。

sentences.en: The notice was put up by the editorial board of the school journal.
sentences.cn: 布告是校刊编委会贴的.

sentences.en: The police arrived, and so did reporters and a photographer from the "Journal".
sentences.cn: 警察赶到了那里，《日报》的记者和摄影师也到了。

sentences.en: The Wall Street Journal uses 220,000 metric tons of newsprint each year.
sentences.cn: 《华尔街日报》每年用去22万公吨新闻纸。

words.tran_cn: 新闻业，新闻工作；报章杂志
新闻工作者；报人；记日志者

phrases.tran_cn: 普通日记簿；普通日记帐
分录，流水分录；日记帐分录
n. 行业杂志，行业刊物

trans.tran_en: a serious magazine produced for professional people or those with a particular interest
